Class ReadFile

java.lang.Object
  ReadFile
public class ReadFile
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides to the BlueJ user in 4600 the ability to read a text file It reads the file one line at a time. It can either return the line as a single String or it can break the string down into individual variables by using a separator character. The individual fields are numbered from one [not from zero]

Constructor Detail

ReadFile

public ReadFile(java.lang.String fN)
This constructor takes a String containing the name of a file. This class is set up so that the file must be in the same folder. A later version may include the capability of reading a file from anywhere in the system.

Parameters:
fN - the name of a file in the curent directory

getStringField

public java.lang.String getStringField(int fieldNumber)
This method returns the nth field from an already read line. It returns a String. If the field number is invalid, the method returns null

Parameters:
fieldNumber - the field number
Returns:
the String value of the nth field

getIntField

public int getIntField(int fieldNumber)
This method returns the nth field from an already read line. It returns an int. If the field number is invalid, the method returns zero

Parameters:
fieldNumber - the field number
Returns:
the int value of the nth field

getDoubleField

public double getDoubleField(int fieldNumber)
This method returns the nth field from an already read line. It returns a double. If the field number is invalid, the method returns zero

fieldNumber - the field number
Returns:
the double value of the nth field

               throws java.io.IOException
